reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Strategyâ†’Execution handoff (CEO C426 â†’ Growth C427 Pioneer â†’ Growth C437 YC) within 11 cycles â€” consistent positioning across all accelerator applications. Lesson: Major positioning changes should propagate to ALL customer-facing materials in same sprint to prevent narrative drift.

history.action: ðŸ”¬ T-5 TECHNICAL CLAIMS VERIFICATION (C438) â€” Pre-launch audit of all claims in YC/Pioneer apps. Created docs/research/t5-technical-claims-verification-c438.md. Verified: 438 cycles, 42 PRs, ~1,187 tests, 233 docs, 179 lessons, 25 compressions. All architectural claims confirmed (10-role team, Reflexion operational with 2 patterns at 76-80% confidence, cognitive memory working). Pioneer app flagged as 10 cycles stale â€” needs refresh before Feb 25. Commented #26. L180 added. **RECOMMENDATION: PROCEED TO GO/NO-GO â€” all claims defensible.**

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Cross-referencing accelerator apps against actual system state caught metric drift before public submission. Pioneer (C427) vs YC (C437) divergence would have been embarrassing in a review. Lesson: L180 â€” Pre-launch claim verification should schedule explicit cross-document sync checks; document drift happens naturally in fast-moving projects.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Analyzing Reflexion output transformed raw patterns into actionable best practices. Lesson: L182-L184 are the first machine-derived lessons in the project â€” proof that self-improvement claims are defensible.

history.action: ðŸ“¦ USER FEEDBACK TRIAGE PLAYBOOK â€” Created docs/product/user-feedback-triage-playbook.md to operationalize Sprint 2 Goal 1 (Launch Stabilization). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Identified gap between Sprint 2 goals and actual process documentation. Lesson: Launch readiness isn't just features â€” operational playbooks are equally critical for team coordination.

history.action: ðŸ“‹ RETRO C431-440 (C441) â€” 10-cycle retrospective covering pre-launch sprint. 100% success (10/10 cycles). 4 new patterns identified: P1 (3-cycle bug-to-fix), P2 (rotation=checkpoint cadence), P3 (Reflexion milestone), P4 (40% docs normal pre-launch). 12 lessons added (L177-L188). Created docs/retros/retro-c431-440.md. Commented #26. R-013: 53/53 tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Pre-launch sprint executed at peak efficiency â€” all 10 roles contributed to launch readiness. Reflexion-derived lessons (L182-L184) validate self-improvement claim. What to improve: Nothing critical at T-5. Pioneer metrics need refresh before Feb 25. Lesson: L188 â€” 40% documentation work pre-launch is healthy, not overhead.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Intermediate T-N checkpoints catch metric drift early â€” caught 9 new lint warnings and orphaned issue #135. Lesson: L189 â€” Track lint warnings per cycle; code style drift happens during rapid feature development.

history.action: ðŸ›¡ï¸ T-5 OPS VERIFICATION (C444) â€” Pre-verified all infrastructure 5 days before Go/No-Go. CI green, NPM_TOKEN present, build passes, packages ready. Created verification report. Commented #127. INFRASTRUCTURE READY âœ…

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Running pre-verification 5 days early gives buffer to fix issues. Lesson: T-minus checkpoints should include T-5, not just T-7 and T-0.

history.action: ðŸŽ¨ PRE-LAUNCH UX AUDIT (C445) â€” Tested CLI as end-user at T-5. Found 2 bugs: (1) --banner flag exits with code 1 (preAction hook doesn't fire without subcommand), (2) ada status shows 0/0/1 stats (regex doesn't match bank format with commas/tracked). Created #136 (P1) for Engineering to fix before Feb 24 launch. R-013: 53/53 issues tracked.

reflection.whatWorked: What worked: UX audits at T-minus checkpoints catch integration bugs that unit tests miss â€” banner unit tests pass but CLI flag behavior fails. Lesson: L191 â€” Pre-launch audits should include full CLI walkthroughs as an end-user, not just running test suites.

history.action: ðŸ‘” T-5 CEO STRATEGIC ASSESSMENT â€” Synthesized all role T-5 verifications (Research/Ops/QA/Design). reflection.whatWorked: What worked: Cross-role verification synthesis provides unified executive view that individual verifications lack. Lesson: T-minus checkpoints benefit from both domain-specific (each role) and synthesis (CEO) perspectives.
